tools/fcconvert.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Convert a dataset to a different file type.

Source
/usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/tools/fcconvert.c,v
Revision
1.7
Date
2006/10/13 18:13:20

Description: Usage is: fcconvert -f new_type orig_file

Todo:
The SAF writer does not fail gracefully (it should ignore things it doesn't understand
Modifications: 01/30/06 Created Wendy Doyle 03/25/06 Changed to use new fc_writeAsDataset instead of doing a copy. 10/13/06 Let it "convert" to the same type. This converts to fclib's conventions for that type. (E.g. for Exodus, it splits the global verts into the meshes, perhaps with duplication). 10/15/07 ACG removed saf

00063                                 {
00064   int i;
00065   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00066   int makeName = 1;
00067   char* orig_dsName = NULL, *new_dsName = NULL;
00068   char* extension;
00069   char extensions[1][20] = { "ex2" };
00070   FC_Dataset orig_ds;
00071   FC_FileIOType new_fileType = FC_FT_NONE;
00072   FC_VerbosityLevel verbose_level = FC_QUIET; 
00073   
00074   // handle arguments
00075   if (argc < 4) {
00076   usage:
00077     printf("Usage: fcconvert [options] -t new_type orig_file\n");
00078     printf("\n");
00079     printf("options: \n");
00080     printf("   -o new_name  : name for the converted dataset\n");
00081     printf("   -h           : print this help message\n");
00082     printf("   -v           : verbose: print warning and error messages\n");
00083     printf("   -V           : very verbose: prints log and error messages\n");
00084     printf("\n");
00085     printf("Converts the dataset to the requested file type. Possible types are\n");
00086     printf("EXO (ExodusII). Unless a new name is provided, the new dataset's\n");
00087     printf("name will have the same root but a different extension. For safety,\n");
00088     printf("fcconvert tries to prevent you from writing to the same file by comparing\n");
00089     printf("path strings. This can be circumvented by using roundabout paths and\n");
00090     printf("symbolic links, so care should still be taken to not overwrite the original\n");
00091     printf("dataset.\n");
00092     exit(0);
00093   }
00094   for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00095     if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-o")) {
00096       i++;
00097       if (i >= argc)
00098      goto usage;
00099       new_dsName = argv[i];
00100       makeName = 0;
00101     }
00102     else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-t")) {
00103       i++;
00104       if (i >= argc)
00105      goto usage;
00106       if (!strcmp(argv[i], "EXO")) {
00107      new_fileType = FC_FT_EXODUS;
00108      extension = extensions[0];
00109       }
00110       else {
00111      printf("Error: unknown file type");
00112      goto usage;
00113       }
00114     }
00115     else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-v")) {
00116       verbose_level = FC_WARNING_MESSAGES;
00117     }
00118     else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-V")) {
00119       verbose_level = FC_LOG_MESSAGES;
00120     }
00121     else if (!strncmp(argv[i], "-h", 2) || !strncmp(argv[i], "-", 1))
00122       goto usage;
00123     else {
00124       if (i+1 > argc)
00125      goto usage;
00126       orig_dsName = argv[i];
00127     }
00128   }
00129   if (!orig_dsName || new_fileType == FC_FT_NONE)
00130     goto usage;
00131 
00132   // Make sure writing file type is supported
00133   if (!fc_isFileIOTypeWriteSupported(new_fileType)) 
00134     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(FC_ERROR, "Request file IO type is not supported");
00135 
00136   // Make new name, if necessary
00137   if (makeName) {
00138     int len;
00139     char* root = fc_getBasenameWOExtension(orig_dsName, 1);
00140     len = strlen(root) + strlen(extension) + 2;
00141     new_dsName = malloc(len*sizeof(char));
00142     if (!new_dsName)
00143       fc_exitIfError(FC_MEMORY_ERROR);
00144     sprintf(new_dsName, "%s.%s", root, extension);
00145   }
00146   // Don't allow write to same file
00147   // FIX!? Test isn't completely strict since you could have different
00148   // paths to the same file and they would look like different names
00149   if (!strcmp(orig_dsName, new_dsName)) 
00150     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(FC_ERROR, "Cannot write to the same file. Use -o "
00151                          "to specify the new dataset filename.");
00152 
00153   // init library & load original dataset
00154   rc = fc_setLibraryVerbosity(verbose_level);
00155   fc_exitIfError(rc);  
00156   rc = fc_initLibrary();
00157   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00158   rc = fc_loadDataset(orig_dsName, &orig_ds);
00159   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "Loading dataset '%s'", orig_dsName);
00160 
00161   // write new dataset
00162   rc = fc_rewriteDataset(orig_ds, new_dsName, new_fileType);
00163   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00164 
00165   // cleanup
00166   if (makeName)
00167     free(new_dsName);
00168   rc = fc_deleteDataset(orig_ds);
00169   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00170   rc = fc_finalLibrary();
00171   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00172 
00173   exit(0);
00174 }
